Module chav1961.purelib
Package chav1961.purelib.basic.growablearrays

Class GrowableByteArray

java.lang.Object
chav1961.purelib.basic.growablearrays.GrowableByteArray
Direct Known Subclasses:
InOutGrowableByteArray
public class GrowableByteArray
extends java.lang.Object

This class implements functionality for the growable byte arrays.

This class is not thread-safe.

Since:
0.0.1
Author:
Alexander Chernomyrdin aka chav1961
See Also:
JUnit tests
LastUpdate:
0.0.4

  • Constructor Details

    • GrowableByteArray

      public GrowableByteArray​(boolean usePlain)

      Create growable byte array instance

      Parameters:
      usePlain - true if you want to use plain array for data keeping. When true, the functionality of the class is similar to the ByteArrayOutputStream class. Using 'false' reduces the memory used, but slow down access time

    • GrowableByteArray

      public GrowableByteArray​(boolean usePlain, int initialPow)

      Create growable byte array instance

      Parameters:
      usePlain - true if you want to use plain array for data keeping. When true, the functionality of the class is similar to the ByteArrayOutputStream class. Using 'false' reduces the memory used, but slow down access time
      initialPow - 2^^initialPow is a piece size of the growable array.

  • Method Details

    • append

      public GrowableByteArray append​(byte data)

      Append data to the end of array

      Parameters:
      data - data to append
      Returns:
      self

    • append

      public GrowableByteArray append​(byte[] data) throws java.lang.NullPointerException

      Append data to the end of array

      Parameters:
      data - data to append
      Returns:
      self
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - when data reference is null

    • append

      public GrowableByteArray append​(byte[] data, int from, int to) throws java.lang.NullPointerException, java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

      Append data to the end of array

      Parameters:
      data - data to append
      from - start position in the data to append
      to - end position in the data to append (excluding self)
      Returns:
      self
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - when data reference is null
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - when from and to indices out of data

    • append

      public GrowableByteArray append​(java.io.InputStream is) throws java.lang.NullPointerException, java.io.IOException

      Append array content from the input stream

      Parameters:
      is - input stream to append content from
      Returns:
      self
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - if the input stream is null
      java.io.IOException - on any I/O errors
      Since:
      0.0.2

    • read

      public byte read​(int index) throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

      Read data from the given index

      Parameters:
      index - array index to get data from
      Returns:
      data got
      Throws:
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - when index outside the data

    • read

      public int read​(int index, byte[] target) throws java.lang.NullPointerException, java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

      Read a piece of data from the given index

      Parameters:
      index - array index to get data from
      target - place to store data to
      Returns:
      real data size got
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - when target reference is null
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - when index outside the data

    • read

      public int read​(int index, byte[] target, int from, int to) throws java.lang.NullPointerException, java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

      Read a piece of data from the given index

      Parameters:
      index - array index to get data from
      target - place to store data to
      from - start position to get data to
      to - start position to get data to (excluding self)
      Returns:
      real data size got
      Throws:
      java.lang.NullPointerException - when target reference is null
      java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException - when index outside the data or from and to indices outside the target

    • length

      public int length()

      Get current size of the array

      Returns:
      current size of the array

      public GrowableByteArray length​(int newLength)

      Resize the array

      Parameters:
      newLength - new size of the array
      Returns:
      self
      Since:
      0.0.2

    • toPlain

      public GrowableByteArray toPlain()

      Convert internal array from sliced to plain form. Speeds up performance, but increase memory to store data

      Returns:
      self if the array was still plain, otherwise new cloned instance with the plain data array

    • toArray

      public byte[] toArray()

      Convert internal data to byte array.

      Returns:
      internal array 'as-is' for plain or clone of the data

    • extract

      public byte[] extract()

      Extract array content as a copy

      Returns:
      array content copy
      Since:
      0.0.2

    • clear

      public void clear()

      Clear array content

    • getInputStream

      public java.io.InputStream getInputStream()

      Create input stream based on the array. Input stream doesn't change array content and/or state. Any number of the input streams can be opened on the same array simultaneously. You must not change array content while input stream is opened

      Returns:
      input stream to read array content
      Since:
      0.0.2
